page.title: 06PILSWORTH INDUSTRIAL ESTATE
page.content: Pilsworth Moor was until the 1960's the site of a large storage base for the R.A.F. In recent years it has been redeveloped as a modern industrial estate, linked to the{M66 motorway. Some of the firms located here are : {Manufacturing- Carvansons - perfumes for soaps. Borden U.K.- industrial resins. Maybank - re-cycled paper. T.H Sellen - machinery (paper and rubber trade). Albany Int.- papermaking felts. {Storage and Distribution Christian Salvesen - food. Spicer Cowan - paper. Holden Vale - cotton wool. Bass North West - beer. United Carriers - various. C. Brown - steel. I.C.I.(n. of block)- chemicals.
